entry.title: Classical Pop n' Lock
entry.content: If I don’t see this on the next season of So You Think You Can Dance, I’ll be surprised and disappointed.

entry.title: Justice, Dominique Dunne, and television
entry.content: A first-person account of a murder trial, by the father of the victim. By coincidence, I was reading this article when I learned of this other murder. Juri Kibuishi, the lady mentioned in the second paragraph, is the sister of the fantastic artist Kazu Kibuishi, author of Amulet, Copper, the Flight anthologies, and Daisy Cutter. When I was reading the article about Juri and Samuel Herr’s death, all I could think about is how much it sounded like a plot right from NCIS, Monk, or the Mentalist. Except, of course, that Kazu and Dominick Dunne have to live the rest of their lives without their sister/daughter. It doesn’t get wrapped up in 42 minutes plus commercials.

entry.title: I'm very confused right now...
entry.content:
How have I never heard of a show that could get James Earl Jones, Leonard Nimoy, Robert Carradine, and Tim Freaking Burton for just one episode? And, going off the opening credits, also pulled in Paul Reubens, Robin Williams, Mick Jagger, and Christopher Reeves!?

I only hope that Shelly Duvall’s Faerie Tale Theatre lives up to it’s cast and crew, as I go off to wander through its six (6!) seasons…
